name: The Barber Multiple Choice Quiz | 'Seinfeld' - Season 5 | 10 Questions

questions.text: When George is unsure of whether he gets a job or not, he talks to Jerry and Elaine about it.  What does the company (that he may or may not be employed at) deal with?
questions.explanation:
Rest stop supplies.

	After a somewhat great interview with an associate at the company, George may have been nearly hired; we don't really know.  The associate was forced to take a certain call, and George left the office.  Now, he's afraid to call since the associate made a big deal about understanding things clearly, and if he calls he fears he may lose the job.  If he doesn't call, he'll never know if he got the job.

questions.text: What is the name of Gino's uncle?
questions.explanation:
Enzo.

	Kramer goes to Monks and shows off his new haircut by Enzo's nephew, Gino.  He tells them he's very proud of it since it wasn't done by that butcher, Enzo.  Enzo's been Jerry's barber for years, so he's afraid to go to Gino, but Kramer assures him that it's Enzo's day off.

questions.text: When offered a choice, George takes a small office at 'his new job'.
questions.explanation:
True.

	George decides just to go to the office despite the fact that he may not have even gotten the job since the associate who interviewed him is on vacation.  In order to prevent anyone from calling the other big people in the company, George takes the small office because he says he likes to feel cozy.

questions.text: At what time does George leave the office on his first day?
questions.explanation:
5:00.

	When George enters room 808 for the first time, he's in a very bland room with dated furniture and boring pictures.  By the time it's five o'clock, George seems to have done no work on the Pensky File, but he continues to pretend to know what he's doing.  George says his co-workers are like family.

questions.text: What is the name of the woman that George's coworkers had a party for at the office?
questions.explanation:
Grace.

	When George is telling Jerry about his great times at the new office, he mentions a party that they threw for Grace.  George says that it was a great party and he made a toast despite the fact that he's only been working there for a few days.  During the toast, people start looking suspicious.

Edward Scissorhands.

	Kramer decides to ask Gino if he'll redo Jerry's hair since it looks so bad, and Gino says he will as long as Enzo doesn't find out.  In order to cover up their conversation, Gino goes on about the Tim Burton film "Edward Scissorhands".  This movie is mentioned constantly throughout the episode.

questions.text: Who does Elaine put into the bachelor auction?
questions.explanation:
Kramer.

	Elaine originally asked Jerry to be in her bachelor auction back before he got his hair cut, but afterwords, they decided it wouldn't work.  Although she doesn't like the idea, Elaine takes Kramer to the auction, and like usual, he ends up messing up.

questions.text: How many months of free haircuts does Newman get for getting some of Jerry's hair?
questions.explanation:
Twelve.

	When Gino leaves the barber shop to go to Jerry's apartment, Enzo asks Newman to get a sample of Jerry's hair to see if it matches up with a bit he found in Gino's apartment.  When Newman goes to Jerry's, he makes himself look like an idiot, but it gets him a year of free haircuts and a comb.

questions.text: What is Mr. Pensky's first name?
questions.explanation:
Arthur.

	While pretending to play drums with pencils on his desk, George is informed by the secretary that Mr. Pensky (of the Pensky File) is there to see George.  Surprisingly, Pensky likes George's work on the files although all he actually did was transfer the contents to an accordion-style folder.  When Pensky is in the middle of an important sentence, the secretary calls in to say that Pensky's car is being towed, and George doesn't get to hear the end of the sentence once again.

questions.text: Who looks after the barber shop when Jerry's barber goes to Jerry's apartment?
questions.explanation:
Newman.

	Enzo goes to Jerry's apartment to confront him and Gino, but they're sidetracked by "Edward Scissorhands" on TV.  Meanwhile, Newman starts cutting hair at the barber shop and Kramer falls off the runway at the bachelor auction.  George loses his job at the office when the associate comes back from his vacation and realizes that George didn't do anything.
